## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 293]]<|/det|>
9709/12  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 310, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[730, 303, 907, 320]]<|/det|>
February/March 2022  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = x^{2} + 2cx + 4\) and a straight line has equation \(y = 4x + c\), where \(c\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 801, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(c\) for which the curve and line intersect at two distinct points.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
The first term of a geometric progression and the first term of an arithmetic progression are both equal to \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
The third term of the geometric progression is equal to the second term of the arithmetic progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 151, 902, 170]]<|/det|>
The fifth term of the geometric progression is equal to the sixth term of the arithmetic progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 183, 920, 216]]<|/det|>
Given that the terms are all positive and not all equal, find the sum of the first twenty terms of the arithmetic progression in terms of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 198, 920, 216]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[262, 83, 771, 320]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 336, 920, 371]]<|/det|>
The circle with equation \((x + 1)^2 +(y - 2)^2 = 85\) and the straight line with equation \(y = 3x - 20\) are shown in the diagram. The line intersects the circle at \(A\) and \(B\), and the centre of the circle is at \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 382, 146, 400]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 382, 544, 401]]<|/det|>
Find, by calculation, the coordinates of \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 383, 920, 401]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Find an equation of the circle which has its centre at \(C\) and for which the line with equation \(y = 3x - 20\) is a tangent to the circle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[306, 83, 700, 348]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 369, 920, 405]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the circle with equation \((x - 2)^2 + y^2 = 8\). The chord \(AB\) of the circle intersects the positive \(y\)-axis at \(A\) and is parallel to the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 415, 146, 433]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 415, 544, 433]]<|/det|>
Find, by calculation, the coordinates of \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 415, 920, 433]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Find the volume of revolution when the shaded segment, bounded by the circle and the chord \(AB\), is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 566, 92]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\mathrm{f}(x) \equiv \mathrm{gh}(x)\), find the values of \(m\) and \(n\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 84, 779, 312]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 327, 920, 378]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a circle with centre \(A\) of radius \(5\mathrm{cm}\) and a circle with centre \(B\) of radius \(8\mathrm{cm}\). The circles touch at the point \(C\) so that \(ACB\) is a straight line. The tangent at the point \(D\) on the smaller circle intersects the larger circle at \(E\) and passes through \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 389, 146, 408]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 389, 479, 408]]<|/det|>
Find the perimeter of the shaded region.

<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 747, 92]]<|/det|>
It is given that a curve has equation \(y = k(3x - k)^{-1} + 3x\), where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 715, 123]]<|/det|>
Find, in terms of \(k\), the values of \(x\) at which there is a stationary point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
